trans-unit.source: Provides methods for writing <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> objects to [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_metro](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-metro-md.md)] documents or to a print queue in batch mode.
Because this class has no constructor, use the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.CreateVisualsCollator%2A> method to create an instance.

The VisualsToXpsDocument writes to the same target <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> as the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter> that creates the VisualsToXpsDocument.
Each <xref:System.Windows.Media.Visual> becomes a page in the document.
Indicates that write operations can begin.
You must call this method before you call any <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument.Write%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument.WriteAsync%2A> methods.
After the last write operation, call <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument.EndBatchWrite%2A>.
Cancels a synchronous writing operation.
For example, an exception is thrown if the Cancel method is called and a writing operation is not in progress.
The state of the <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument"></xref> is not compatible with a Cancel operation.
Cancels an asynchronous writing operation.
For example, an exception is thrown if the CancelAsync method is called and a writing operation is not in progress.
The state of the <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument"></xref> is not compatible with a CancelAsync operation.
Indicates that write operations must end.
After the last call to <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument.Write%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument.WriteAsync%2A>, call this method.
You must call <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument.BeginBatchWrite%2A> before any write operations.
Writes a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> synchronously to an <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> that is written.

Writes a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> synchronously to an <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref> and includes a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref>.
This method does not validate or modify the specified `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

If necessary, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is specific to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> and is valid for a specified printer.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> that is written.
A <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> that represents the default printing preferences for the document.
Writes a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> asynchronously to an <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> that is written.

Writes a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> asynchronously to an <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref> and includes additional information that the caller wants to pass to an event handler.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> that is written.
An object that contains data that the caller wants to pass to the <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WritingCompleted"></xref> event handler.

Writes a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> asynchronously to an <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref> and includes a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref>.
This method does not validate or modify the specified `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

If necessary, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is specific to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> and is valid for a specified printer.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> that is written.
A <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> that represents the default printing preferences for the document.

Writes a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> asynchronously to an <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>; also includes a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> and any additional information that the caller wants to pass to an event handler.
This method does not validate or modify the specified `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

If necessary, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is specific to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> and is valid for a specified printer.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> that is written.
A <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> that represents the default printing preferences for the document.
An object that contains the data that the caller wants to pass to the <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WritingCompleted"></xref> event handler.
